item.title: MSc Artificial Intelligence
item.description: Core modules: Ethics, Privacy, AI in Society Introduction to Machine Learning Introduction to Symbolic Artificial Intelligence MSc Software Engineering Practice and Group Project Python Programming Individual Project Optional modules: Computational Finance Computer Vision Databases Deep Learning Machine Learning for Imaging Maths for Machine Learning Principles of Distributed Ledgers

item.title: BSc Mathematics, Operational Research, Statistics and Economics
item.description: Awards First Class Honours - overall grade 84% Department of Statistics Academic Excellence Award 2019 for overall performance 3rd out of 250 students. Ranked 1st out of 537 students in Warwick Business School’s Foundations of Finance. Full list of modules Mathematics Year 1 Linear Algebra Mathematical Analysis Sets and Numbers Mathematical Techniques Year 2 Mathematical Methods Operational Research Year 1 Mathematical Programming I Year 2 Mathematical Programming II Year 3 Applied Optimisation Methods Simulation Statistics Year 1 Statistical Laboratory I Introduction to Probability Year 2 Stochastic Processes Mathematical Statistics Part A Mathematical Statistics Part B Linear Statistical Modelling Year 3 Professional Practise of Data Analysis Multivariate Statistics Programming for Data Science Generalised Linear Models for Regression and Classification Economics, Finance and Game Theory Year 1 Introduction to Quantitative Economics Year 2 Foundations of Finance Mathematical Economics 1A Mathematical Economics 1B Games, Decisions and Behaviour Year 3 Actuarial Methods Finance and Financial Reporting

item.title: Python for Data Analysis
item.description: As I worked through this book by Wes McKinney, I strengthened my foundations in Python and went on to work on a number of projects.

item.title: Plug and Play Tech Centre - Singapore
item.description: Why Plug and Play I got the opportunity to work at Plug and Play in Singapore due to the generosity of my friend Matt, who I met while studying at the Chinese Language Institute in Guilin. Back in 2017, we had been some of the only 外国人 (foreigners) in Guilin, and so despite him being a few years older than me, we had enjoyed exploring the town and the bars of Guilin together.

item.title: Chinese Language Institute
item.description: During my final year of school, I found it difficult to choose what I wanted to study at university. Therefore I decided to take a year out to give myself time and life experience before making my choice. Having decided to take a year out, I now had to decide what to do with it. I wanted to do something that I would never be able to do at any other point in my life.

item.title: Piano
